name: Reading Mom
text: My 6 year old boy has been learning playing the piano with the Madison Music Academy for about 6 months. He has been progressing very fast. Mr. Brown built him a strong foundation of learning the rhythm and beats in the music first. From there he introduced playing the melodies and chords. Mr. Brown teaches theories and techniques along with musical creativity in a balanced way. He encouraged my boy to compose a 8 measure of song in the very beginning of his lessons. Now, my son can play a children song with both hands playing chords and melodies. He comes to the piano -voluntarily-playing all the major scales, 2 octaves going up and down by himself! Mr. Brown uses many unconventional methods to teach music to his students. But they works! I have seen it from my son. Mr. Brown is also good at communication. He listens to parents' concerns and ideas to make the lessons more suitable to the child. I am pleased about my son's progress and music experience with Madison Music Academy.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. I am so glad you guys chose to take piano lessons from the academy.

name: Sarah Bogardus
text: Eric has a passion for music and loves sharing his knowledge with kids. He is a patient and encouraging instructor and my daughter enjoys her lessons. As a parent, I appreciate the additional emphasis on music theory and exposure to different genres.

resp.text: Thank You So Much Sarah. It has been a true pleasure to teach your daughter in our plucked strings curriculum.

name: Melissa Wright
text:
Mr Brown is a patient guitar, piano, and voice teacher. He not only teaches how to play the instruments but educates the kids on how to read music and have a true understanding of the music they are reading. The kids are excited for their lessons each week. Music homework is fun and informative and actually gets completed without me having to say anything.
Thanks Mr Brown!

resp.text: Thank you so much. I am glad to know that your children are enjoying their music lessons.

name: Jeff Burns
text: Eric is an awesome instructor.  Our 5 yr old boy Will has learned so much from him and enjoys the weekly lessons.  He’s going to be a guitar rock star soon!  Highly recommend for getting young children involved in music!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words. It a pleasure to see him learn and be excited about his music lessons.

name: Brandon Terry
text: Mr. Eric Brown is an awesome music teacher and an awesome person! He gave me my very first job years ago when I was still in high school. Now he is helping to spread the joy and knowledge of music with those who otherwise wouldn’t have the opportunity. I would highly recommend him and his new program!

resp.text:
Thanks Brandon!  It was a pleasure teaching you way
back then.

name: Tracy Morris
text: We're very pleased to have found a music school as awesome as Madison Music Academy. Fantastic instruction, awesome owner, pleasant atmosphere. What else could I possibly as for? Very highly recommended!

name: Taylor Carter
text: Eric is a wonderful teacher and great person! He always showed up ready to teach and always with a smile! :) highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you Taylor

name: Chris Schafer
text: Finally found a music school where the teachers really care and make learning music fun!!  Thank you for all you do. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks Chris! Your kind words mean a lot.

name: Jeff Comas
text: Caring and Knowledgeable staff. A great place to learn music. 🎶

resp.text: Thanks Jeff!

name: Jeff Comas
text: Eric is a brilliant musician, experienced music educator, and strong comunicator. A great choice to help you on your musical journey.

resp.text: Thanks Jeff! Since you are the owner of the largest music school in Tennessee, what an honor to have you think that.

name: Lori Black
text: Great professional school that goes beyond the standard of other music schools. Love it!!!!

resp.text: Looking forward to serving you guys for many years to come.

name: Amy
text: Finally a Music Academy on County Line Road! Great place to learn piano and guitar lessons.

resp.text: We are glad to be here to serve you.

name: Derrick Green
text: I wish that Madison Music Academy was here when I was a kid. Wow! Music lessons taught the right way.

resp.text: Thanks Derrick!

name: Lori Bush
text: Our daughter loves SHMA. She started with piano lessons then moved to orchestra. Great bunch of kids and instructors!

name: Vicky Mason
text: My daughter has completed string beans violin classes,  and she is currently taking private lessons at Seed Harvest.  I am amazed at how she has blossomed in her musical journey thus far. The Simpsons are wonderful with children. They have realistic expectations of attention span for young children and provide praise & support to encourage them to do their best. My daughter looks forward to going there each week.  I highly recommend Seed Harvest Music Academy!

name: Ben C
text: Being homeschooled I never really had a chance to play in a school band, I hadn't even picked up or played a Trombone before I joined this group, but over the two years I've been going here it's become one of my favorite hobbies. I'm always looking forward to learning and playing music for Orchestra, Jazz Band, and the Senior Guitar Ensemble I joined recently. Overall Mr. And Mrs. Simpson have been very supportive of my Music journey, I am deeply grateful for the opportunity they have given me.

name: Sarah Glover
text:
We have been customers of Seed Harvest for almost four years, and we love it!
Micah and Brittany are excellent teachers, and the fact that they offer options for homeschoolers in the area, makes them unique. If anyone within an hour’s drive from Seed Harvest is looking for a music class for their children, you definitely should go here!

name: gail lader
text: Seed Harvest offers both classes and private lessons.  I have children in both.  The teachers are patient, fun, and have realistic expectations when it comes to practice and performance while challenging students to consistently improve.  When discussing the appropriate direction to take with lessons or classes, I have never felt like they were trying to sell a product, but always felt like the teachers were genuinely interested on providing quality instruction and instilling the joy of music making in all of their students.

name: Amy Dunn
text: We absolutely love Seed Harvest! Such a great addition to our community. We love the orchestra, very cost effective way for our children to begin music. Micah and Brittany are wonderful!

name: Cindy Burgett
text: Wonderful instruction from wonderful teachers.  Kids are immersed into music from the beginning.  The teachers are so amazing with the kids.  I highly recommend this music school!!!

name: Lauren Randall
text: Seed Harvest has been a very important part of our homeschool life for the last 3 years. The quality of instruction is excellent and the rates are affordable for the amount of instruction time the kids get in the orchestra. Love it!!!

name: Heather A
text: These guys are the best! My children have been students of Micah and Brittany for a few years now and it has been a great experience!

name: Brandi Bridges
text: Seed-Harvest has been the biggest blessing to our family. Micah and Brittany love music and do a fantastic job of teaching children.

name: Amy A
text: This is a wonderful place. All skill levels are welcomed, and the Simpsons are very patient with their students.

name: Guadelupe McLane
text: The Simpson’s are excellent, patient teachers.   My children love going to lessons and have learned so much from them.

name: Heath Braswell
text: My daughter loves the music class

name: T Maupin
text: I appreciate that the Simpsons have fostered my childrens’ musical ability. They have initiated learning, challenged my children and encouraged innovative thinking through music. The Simpsons are easy to work with and provide a valuable service.

name: Courtney Ferguson
text: Our family has participated in several classes and we love them and the owners!

name: Teri Uhler
text: My son TJ has been with them since he was in 8th grade and now he is going to be a senior. I cant say enough about how much he has grown as a musican and young man. Micah and Brittany are the best!!!!

name: Alana Sartin
text: Excellent Instructors! Very knowledgeable and great with kids of all ages!

name: Sarah McAfee
text: Very sweet and knowledgeable couple who have a love of music.

name: Crystal Perdue
text: This is an amazing school for music!

name: Brittney Lynn
text: Wonder place ! Great teachers!

name: June Schonebeck
text: Awesome instructors

name: Michael Linzey
text: Good place for new and used musical instruments. Lessons on playing different types of instruments.

name: Robyn Blackmon
text: Moved and tuned my piano. Tony is awesome and the piano sounds better than it has in years!

resp.text: Thank You . Glad it Sounds good

name: Todd Miller
text: I learned how to play here as a  young child, and now I'm a pro-level guitar player in my 40s.  Glad to see he's still here.  I didn't take lessons directly from Tony back then, but he arranged recitals for the students, and gave me my first experience playing in front of people.  My favorite place in Cullman

resp.text: Thank you for your review

name: dexter leigeber
text: Very helpful and nice, low prices on new and used music equipment

resp.text: Thanks for the nice review. Have a great week

name: Tina Cagle Herfurth
text: Tony is a great teacher with incredible patience and the ability to break things down in a way you can understand them. He is willing to work with you on the things that interest you.

resp.text: Thank You

name: Keith Sellers
text: The very first vintage guitar I learned to play had gotten a broke tuner. To my surprise Tony had a spare one and it was restored to original. Didn’t know where I was going to find one.

resp.text: Glad we could help You. Thanks for The Review

name: Paul Reynolds
text: Very friendly and helpful

resp.text: Thank you

name: Gary Swann
text: Great place nice thing nice people

resp.text: Thank You

name: Tigerchris 16
text: Excellent store and music school very nice people and they are very helpful with what you need.

name: donnie collins
text: Learn how to play .

name: john driver
text: Great music lessons

name: Leslie Burns
text:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this Amoeba!

I enjoy coming here when visiting my favorite little hippy town! I don't however enjoy the homeless people outside the store trying to get all my cd money! grrr!!

Customer service here is great, people are friendly and they ALWAYS have what I am looking for. Next purchase: Neutral Milk Hotel vinyl box set! MY DREAM!

name: Michael Nagle
text: Great place to get lessons my son has come a long way learning the piano

name: Tino Amado
text: great customer service.

name: Dylan Blunt
text: Just really good customer service

name: FL Rowe
text: Staff is helpful and kind

name: Weston Braisted
text: wow

name: Mac Thomas
text: Mia,Mia,Mia!!! The most knowledgeable person I have ever spoke to on the phone! She made me feel safe and secure with my purchase from the first sentence! Mere words can not describe how comfortable she made me feel! MIA, THANK YOU!!!

name: Mike wells
text: Friendly and knowledgeable.  Had item needed

name: W. Webster
text: Great as always, love the staff. May have to wait sometimes but worth it for the service. They answer questions and find what you need or want.

name: Demetrius Lockhart
text: AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE EXCELLENT KNOWLEDGE OF PRODUCTS AND ALL OF THE STAFF WAS SUPER FRIENDLY PHENOMENAL EXPERIENCE!

name: Leon Harris
text:
I don't know what you're talking about.
Sure don't go to Guitar Center for lessons!

name: Katie Grace Mitchell
text: Bought instruments from here and its great because of COVID-19 they open at 12

name: Josef Bush
text: AWESOME

name: Marcelino Franco
text:
(Translated by Google) It's fine

(Original)
Esta bien

name: Grant Sagan
text: Lots of memories here.

name: Noah
text: Great acoustics for classical music especially lyrical pieces. Wonderdurful facility and comfortable seats.

name: Wayne Cobb
text: I have been to the Moody Music Hall twice in the past few years to watch my children at MPA. The inside and outside of Moody Music Hall is beautiful but the courtyard outside is in need of some upkeep! It looks like when it rains it washes a lot of the mulch from around the building down into the low spot in the middle of the courtyard.

name: Samuel Cregan
text: Beautiful location, very nice, was here for MS honor band.

name: Filiz Akyuz
text: Good atmosphere 😉🎶

name: Ryan Kirkley
text: Have been in and been to many concert in the this hall. Beautiful music hall.

name: Fox101
text: This place was extremely disappointing I came here to go see an awesome concert but instead they played boring classical music.

name: Summer MacGregor
text: We had a negative experience at Arts and showed up to Latta Music feeling pretty defeated.  My son has a French horn that we were trying to get repaired. Unfortunately, it is not repairable, but John and Mitchell were very kind and chose to educate us, instead of insult us like they did at Arts. They seem to truly care about their customers! They even offered to try to find us a good, used French horn, without any pressure. I would recommend them to anyone looking for an instrument or lessons!

name: Angie Blaxton
text: Our family has been using Latta Music for years for instrument rental, purchase and lessons. The owners are such great people! I have had multiple experiences in which they went above and beyond to provide excellent customer service. We have also had great dealings with the teachers who obviously love to teach music and love children. I really can not say enough good things.

name: Susanne Goocher
text: The owners are wonderful people. They are extremely knowledgeable and will go above and beyond for you. I have been extremely satisfied with all purchases, rentals, and lessons from Latta Music. The music instructors are top notch. They will work hard to find you and/or your child someone who is a good match for lessons. Easy to work with for scheduling and payments. We have rented and purchased several instruments from here and have all been very pleased. Go to Latta Music they are the best in Dothan.

name: Sarah Germanson
text: Owners of the store are very helpful and have gone above and beyond in customer service! We have rented multiple instruments and bought 3 there. They have been knowledgeable and helpful in finding the best price and instrument. Would highly recommend Latta Music.

name: Melanie Nicholls
text: Great music store! Friendly and knowledgeable staff is more than willing to help with any questions or needs. My kids take lessons and are enjoying those also. Would highly recommend Latta Music for any music needs!

name: Sam Nolen
text: Can’t say enough good things about Latta. I bought my first big keyboard from here after visiting several times to figure out what I liked and David and Chris were so patient with me. I never felt rushed or pressured to be a big spender, which I appreciate. Very open to students as well, and I know that I will bring my kids here when they decide to take up piano/guitar.

name: Bonnie Boucher
text: Permanently closed!

name: Jessie Holmes
text: We are always welcomed with smiles and conversation. My daughter is really enjoying her guitar lessons here and we look forward to beginning vocal lessons in the next year!

name: Andrew Muench
text: you should go there its great

name: Carolyn Bennett
text: Great people and sweet teachers!

name: Jenny Gomillion
text: Very dissatisfied with service received from the owner. Would never do business here again.

name: Clarissa Brown
text: Just want to say thank you. Great doing business with great people. Happy to hear good news today. Our family understands the struggle. We would recommend this company for all your instrumental needs. Again thank you.

name: 213 productions
text: Extremely knowledgeable and friendly. We purchased a saxophone from them. We've always been very helpful and they really do know their stuff

name: Jenny Mayers
text: Nancy Hallman is a patient, funny music teacher. She motivates my young teen to practice and play to her highest potential. She is an amazing teacher and my daughter thinks very highly of her.

name: Jahari Watkins
text: I get me saxophone reed from her and she is so nice

name: Laura Campbell
text: Very kind and helpful!

name: Chasity Hassell
text: Sweetest people. I actually went to a place in Decatur and they did not have what I needed called them and they said they had it but I was not going to make it before close. They told me to come on they would wait and still provided great customer service. Thank you so much!!! Will be back and recommend them to everyone!!!

name: Carly Wethington-Nagy (NipNeps)
text: They have simply been fully honest between myself and my brother when it comes to our instrument care as we have on numerous accounts returned time after time for repairs and cleanings. Not once have we had any trouble with the way they worked, giving us estimates on all sorts of timing to receive our instruments. I recommend this place to any newer band members.

name: Carla Dawn
text: We dropped off a banjo about 10 days ago with a lady that seemed competent and assured us that restringing it and replacing a few screws would be no issue and cost less than $25; 5 phone calls and 10 business days later, we still do not have our instrument returned to us. We are not happy and feel we have been given the run around. They keep assuring us that it is ready to be picked up but when we arrive, it suddenly needs a few more minutes. We had intended to purchase not only a clarinet in the future but also an oboe from these people but I'm afraid after this incident with the banjo, we will reconsider. We do not feel valued as customers. This is ridiculous and from now on we will take our business elsewhere.

name: Jamie Pennington
text: We brought my daughter's clarinet to have a few pads replaced. We were told that the instrument was generic brand and we should look into getting a nicer one. We purposely did not buy our daughter an expensive clarinet because she was in 6th grade and she'd never played before. I told.them to replace the few pads and we'd look into a better clarinet if she made the advanced band. They quoted me a price for the few pads and we could pick her instrument up in a few days. When we went to pick it up we were told the cost was over $200. Apparently they changed most of her pads and not just the few we'd talked about. They never called to ask if we wanted this much work done or to let us know the cost before taking it upon themselves to do it and expect us to pay the outrageous amount. It didn't make any sense to me if they said the clarinet was off brand, etc. You'd think they'd ask if we wanted to spend that much to fix it. We only paid  $50 for her new clarinet on Craigslist and would have put the  $200 into buying her a nicer one instead of paying to fix the one she has. When I confronted them about not asking before doing such an expensive repair, they were non apologetic and basically pay the $200 or they keep her clarinet. We paid it, but will never go back again.

name: Marcie Eppling
text: The Hallman family has been nothing but helpful and encouraging since we walked through the door in October 2013.  Both of my children take lessons from them.  We bought one instrument and we also rent an instrument from them.  We have had no issues and I would definitely recommend them.

name: Kim Perry
text: Owner is very crass......that's fine, we all have are personalities......BUT maintenance insurance is supposedly included in the (higher than anyone else's) monthly rental fees and when I took the sax in for maintenance they wanted to charge my just over $200 for things that were supposedly covered. Not cool.

name: Katherine M. Barber
text: They were excellent!! So nice,kind and absoultly perfect service!! They are definitely much more than 5 stars, and I really recommend to come to their store!!!

name: Jaime Garner
text: By far the worst experience of my life.  My daughter joined Beginners Band at her school to play the flute.  Hallman's was suggested by the band instructor so we went there for her flute.  Upon arrival they quoted me a $1200 flute and when I said we would not be purchasing a new flute because she was not 100% sure if this was her passion I was told about the lease to own program.  What a mistake?  I paid first and last month payments and returned the instrument within 2 weeks and was advised that my request for my last month payment would be considered a refund.  This company is a scam and wants you to pay for a service that is not rendered.  I was even told that the instrument had to be sent off for cleaning and inspection and that costs them money however this is something that they do in-house.  When the report comes back is when  Mr. Hallman will determine if I am entitled to a refund!

name: Garrett B. - Gtmkm98
text: Great place. Great music lessons. Great staff. It's all great.

name: Sara Coble
text: I HATE this place. They are very rude. When I came in they asked me things like "have you ever dropped your flute" in a very rude tone. I was tempted to just walk out of there and go to Southeastern. All they did was fix a leak and charged me about 60 dollars.When I picked up my flute they played it without my permission and basically told me I had a bad flute. The next time I needed a repair I took my flute to Southeastern and they did a wonderful job. Yes, both stores are a little over priced but Southeastern does a flawless job and is very polite.

name: Johanna Massey
text: The service is excellent! The staff saved my son in a bind. Highly recommend!

name: Ben Neighbors
text:
I asked my son's band director where to send my son for lessons, without hesitation he recommend Hallman's Music. I asked other parents and had received the same answer. My son took lessons from Nancy Hallman and Phyllis Peterson over a period of seven years. Both instructors were excellent. He went from being a sub-par beginning musician to making district band in a few months and made superior ratings every year there after. It was an astonishing change.
I had a co-worked who had a junior in high school and she was at the bottom of the barrel musically, she was in the schools "C" band as the only upper class man. I called Nancy Hallman and handed my co-worker the phone and told her to set up lessons. She set up lessons and her daughter took lessons from Mr. Peterson, two months later she made district band. The next school year she made the school jazz band after 5 months of lessons. This young lady is now a music major at the University of Alabama in Huntsville. Hallmans transformed this student that had no passion for music into a musician.
My son played the alto sax, I noticed year after year that 7 of the 8 sax players in district band members were Hallman's students, both at the middle school level and high school levels. State honor bands were the same way, Hallman's students. One of my son's peers was awarded the top musician in the state his senior year in high school.
After reading some of the other reviews here I would make the following observations:
If you want to put a pacifier in your kid's mouth buy a $50 instrument off Craig's list and have your kids dissatisfied and frustrated from playing an unplayable instrument, then this is probably not the place for you.
If Hallmans replace additional pads, it was because they presumed that you wanted an instrument that could actually be played by a student. My experience is when you think a pad or two is leaking and you fix it, you will find the next pad leaking and it was not particularity identifiable until you fix the two pads with the more significant leak.
If you want to raise a kid with skilled music instruction and the self esteem from being a good musician, then you have found the right place. The instructors are phenomenal.
I was always treated fairly with the sales and service and I ended up with a highly skilled musician who I am very proud of.

name: Evie
text: I got my sax from hallmans and they have been every so kind! I'm in 7th grade and have been taking lessons from Mrs. Nacy, and I'm going to midstate this year. I'm the first every in my school to go,and thanks to Mrs.Nacy and everyone there I am improving every day. I recommend this store to anyone who is looking to bye an instrument for there child!

name: Oree Tanking
text: I appreciate that the owner works with a college student's budget when tuning instruments.

name: Katherine Watson
text: I took my trumpet in to get a dent out of the valves, and without my consent the trumpet was chem cleaned. Any of the crud that was on the inside was gone (that could've been fixed by me washing it at home) and the debt was gone, but the cleaning stripped the lacquer off of the trumpet. Hallman's refused to re-lacquer it unless we paid for it. I haven't gone back since...

name: Blake Dimick
text: Just an honest to goodness guitar shop with the best damn luthier in the river region for repairs! Matt approaches each guitar as he would his own and his attention to detail is phenomenal. He just re fretted my 65 Fender Mustang and its never played better!

name: D “LowAndFast” G
text: Tweed music is stellar! This place is really something special. Matt is a wealth of knowledge when it comes to all things music and the environment itself is very unique and inviting.

name: Berrey Art
text: I had a Fender Acoustic fall of my wall and cracked guitar pretty badly.  Matt ordered the original wood/material and hand fixed it back to original quality. Highly recommend! Great communication.

name: Cameron Heyward
text: I’ve never been to a guitar shop I like more than tweed. Matt’s knowledge and skill as a luthier Is incredible. I’ve had 5 guitars setup at this shop and they always come out perfectly. Matt has always been friendly and helpful regarding any questions or advice I need, and has never tried to up-charge or oversell me. If you’re looking for a great deal on a guitar, I’d also recommend stopping by. I’ve bought both an electric and acoustic here, and have gotten a great deal on both.

name: Terrence Coleman (tcoleman701)
text: I'm just getting into playing guitar and had three new guitars in need of professional setup. Was getting the run around from the store I bought them and I was fortunate enough to find Tweed's. Matt was and is awesome! He was able to get my guitars setup on the same day and did a phenomenal job! The store has this very welcoming aura in addition to Matt's friendly and down to earth demeanor, you know your equipment is in great hands. Definitely will be a repeat customer, if you're looking for an amazing music store experience....look no further than Tweed. Highly recommend over any big brand store in the area.

name: Glenn Mize
text: Just had a complete set up done on my Gibson ES-335 Government Model and it is perfect. Great job and friendly atmosphere. Best in town.

name: Aric Huffman
text: Absolutely amazing store, love the atmosphere, the service is always top notch, and the pure quality of the store is absolutely phenomenal, best around

name: Paul Baker
text: Matt can usually fix it but if he can't he will be the first person to tell you and probably know someone that can.

name: Willard Sitz
text:
Edit: Worth the drive back to follow up. This is what a guitar shop should look and feel like.  Cool gear, big plush seating to take your time getting to know the guitar in your hands.  That guitar, by the way, at a reasonable price, with a rotating stock so it's different every time and an open workbench up front keeps your visits interesting.

I love coming by to window shop. They were closed down back and July (12th) and agin today. Maybe one day I’ll get to go inside!

resp.text: Sorry man.  This is a one man operation and we are on family vacation this week. Drop by soon.

name: Rodney Dwyer
text: Super friendly, laid back atmosphere, but he definitely knows guitars. Expert, professional, and approachable; unlike the big chain places that make you feel like an outsider.

name: Mike Gossett
text: Matt is the man and still the only tech I let touch my guitars. We moved away but Tweed is one of the places I make a point to stop in at every time I'm back in town.

name: Soccer Storm
text: Nice shop

name: Bill McNabb
text: Awesome Shop. The folks are class A people and coffee is always on! If they don’t have an item in stock Tara will find it for you. If you need repairs Bruce & Lucas will take care of you. Lots of guitars, amps etc… and on occasion you’ll find a few vintage pieces too. One of the last true Mom & Pops shops left!

name: stephanie mason
text: My daughter was the one who found this place with my aunt. They offer lessons for affordable prices, one less for $25 and four for $80. My daughter has been doing lessons for three months now. The atmosphere when you walk into the shop is welcoming and laid back, and they let you feel like you are family. I highly recommend coming here and being apart of it.

resp.text: Thanks Stephanie! Always a pleasure!

name: David Butler
text: Went to guitar pro's and had a set up done on my acoustic. I was well pleased with my guitar. This place has a great selection of guitars,amps and accessories. And most of all these folks were friendly and helpful.The prices were great too.I really enjoyed meeting these folks. I'll be sure to go back when I need something.THANKS GUITAR PRO'S#😁

resp.text: Thanks David!!

name: Jay Jordan
text: Lovely small town guitar store. I’ve bought several guitars from here and never had a bad experience, great atmosphere for guitar lovers and a surprisingly large stock for such a small building!

name: Your Mom
text: I’ve had all of my guitars worked on here and its always amazing work. very reasonable prices on gear AND repairs!! Thanks guitar pros :)

resp.text: Thank you. It's our pleasure to serve you!

name: ThumperDelta Resistance
text:
WAS our trusted source for guitars and gear.
Took in a Seagull acoustic to have the battery and strings replaced at the end of December 2020(only having someone else do it because of the value of the guitar).
The battery went dead MUCH faster than normal (usually takes 6 months). We are very aware that leavi g guitars plugged in drai s the battery. That was NOT the case here. We took it out and found they had installed a promotional  Progressive Insurance smoke detector battery in it. Instead of what we are used to getting, Energizer or Duracell. I called and was told that we should have told them we wanted a better battery. It cost us more than $30 for the strings and a battery replacement. No offer to replace it. The lady said they just use whatever is "handy". I don't pay for what's handy. So much for being Pro's. If the lady had simply apologized, that would have been the end of it. I wasn't looking for anything other than to let them know that a substandard battery had been installed. When we brought it in initially, we asked for the strings to be changed and the battery replaced. No one told us at that time that we weren't being charged for the battery, just that what we asked for was $30, if I had been advised of that I would have either asked for a better battery or brought my own. I hung up when her tone told me how disgusted she was that I called with a problem. As for my other reviews of other businesses you mentioned, I review honestly and fairly. If you notice, I have many very positive reviews of several companies in the area. I managed customer service depts with 4 Fortune 500 Companies in my career. Again, I wasn't asking for anything except courtesy, which was unfortunately lacking. The lady I spoke with had a "how dare you complain" kind of attitude. (modified for clarity based on the reply from the company)

resp.text: We did not even charge you for a battery, however we did offer to replace the battery just before you hung up. We always strive to please ALL of our customers. Sorry about your bad experences with all the other bussinesses around town as well.

name: XL A
text: A fantastic, friendly guitar shop. I have taken my daughter's and my guitars there to be repair and adjusted, for some years now. Quality and price can't be beat by any other shop I have visited. They have a wide variety of instruments, amps, drums, electronics, accessories, at great prices. Don't miss out on such a great local business.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We love what we do, and we love helping nice people like you!

name: Daniel Entrekin
text: Such a friendly and helpful staff! Made me feel like a VIP and I’ll be coming back! Shop local

resp.text: Thank you Daniel!

name: Ken Chaney
text: Love this store and the people who own it.  I try to buy locally when I can.  This is a very friendly place to visit and I go there often.  This store is locally owned so please try to get by there instead of always ordering on line.

resp.text: Thanks Ken! See you soon!

name: Terry Butler
text: Bruce and Tara are the most wonderful people you will ever meet, and I highly recommend Guitar Pro's LLC to everyone !

resp.text: Thank you Terry!

name: Scott Fleming
text:
I would recommend to everyone.
They offer a large selection of products, and services.
Best of all they have an amazing staff that are:
very friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thanks Scott! Please come visit us!

name: Justin Manis
text: Went in just to look around and put a guitar in may away affordable prices along with an amazing selection of instruments to choose from not to mention the friendly staff no pressure to buy I was left alone to shop played several guitars I’ll definitely be buying again soon

resp.text: Thank you Justin!

name: Russell Rich
text: Very nice people and helpful on the information I was seeking concerning a musical instrument

resp.text: Thank you Russel!

name: Dan Skinner
text: Hey Chris, this is Daniel Skinner from AT&T. Leaving a 5 star review for your shop even though I'm in Dallas now. Haven't even been to your new store but I know you and your folks are doing an awesome job. Miss you sir!

resp.text: Thanks Dan but Chris has moved to South Al.  New owners now, thanks!

name: Judith Adamson
text: We visited for the first time last week. These folks are awesome! My 16 year old son is taking up electric guitar. They are so friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you Judith!

name: Deez Balls
text: Have a decent variety of all different kinds of cords and instruments and the guitars rule great prices too. And the lady in there is always super sweet

resp.text: Thanks for the kind review! (ha ha deez balls!)

name: Jeff D
text: I like this store.  Good selection. Friendly folks.

name: Mason Howard
text: Friendly staff they have a few harmonicas

name: Christopher Fink
text:
Very friendly staff and excellent customer service.
My guitar setup exceeded my expectations and she plays better than ever.  He does amazing work, and prices are very affordable!

Good turn-around as well. Overall, a very good experience!

name: Lucas Clark
text: Great family owned guitar store. The prices are amazing and so is the inventory. The repair work has a quick turn around and it’s phenomenal.

name: Kenny Johnson
text: I bought an Epiphone les Paul special and a few things to get started again after a 4 year break of playing guitar. The woman that helped me listened to what i had to say  instead of trying to sell me things I didn't need or want. I came back a few days later because the overdrive on my amp quit working, the same woman helped me when i needed to decide whether i should buy a new amp or a distortion pedal. Once again she listened to me and my concerns instead of trying to get me to spend more money than i needed. I'd give this place 100 stars if i could but unfortunately 5 stars is the max. I'll be heading back in a few weeks  for more supplies even though i could just order online. Guitar Pro's LLC has made me into a loyal customer. Keep up the good service.

resp.text: Thank you Kenny! We are glad to help!

name: Joshua Spencer
text: Awesome folks, and a nice guitar selection.   First time in the store but they really made me feel like family.   Go here.   Buy stuff.   🤘

resp.text: Thank you Joshua!

name: Billy Barron
text: Great place people very friendly and willing to help.

resp.text: Thank you Billy! We are glad to have you visit us!

name: Josh Johnson
text: Love this store!!! Everybody is very nice and super helpful!!! Everytime I need a new piece of equipment I come here first. If there was an option for 10/10 I would give it that rating

name: J. Marcus R.
text: Another 5 stars. Bruce and his people took care of the when I was in a pinch (and he was already busy) . Great people, not to mention an awesome shop with some nice guitars

resp.text: Thanks! It is our pleasure is to help our people. Come visit us!

name: Jeff
text: I bought a guitar for $2,875 from this shop online and they listed it as mint condition.  I had to take it to a local luthier to have the frets polished because they were so dirty the guitar was unplayable.  The shop refused to even split the cost ($50),  wow!  Incredible.

name: Caren Alexander
text: Awesome store. They are super friendly and know their stuff. It's great for buying new or used guitars as well as accessories. They will also fix your old one up to sound new again. I wouldn't go anywhere else.

name: GoldTop556
text: Good folks here

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Derek Jman
text: Tara amd Bruce are great people and everyone should come here for their musical needs. Drums, amps, guitars, you name it!

resp.text: Thank you Derek!

name: Steve Taylor
text: Had a 1980 Electra guitar worked on at Guitar Fx and man did it come out great. They straightened out the neck put new strings on it adjusted the pick ups fixed the tuners and now it plays like new again. Thanks Chris and staff. I highly recommend your store to all my friends and family.

name: Dawn Campbell
text: Guitar Pros donated a guitar for a give away to one of the Wounded Warriors Christmas Party and I am the luck winner.  I am so grateful for my early Christmas present. Thanks so much.

name: Chaz Harrison
text: This is where i go to buy anything music, We have even got our daughter into drum lessons. Every person in the store is nice and more than willing to answer questions and help out how they can.

name: Z Dawg
text: Great service, great people, great gear. What more could you ask for.!

resp.text: Z Dawg! Our pleasure!

name: Biancah Mckinney
text: Great customer service and very professional!!!

resp.text: Thanks Biancah!

name: Jason Gaiters
text: I just went in to browse the guitars. This place has a very amazing selection and the guy that greeted me was super friendly. I'll be going back for lessons soon. 5/7 (10/10) would stop by again!

name: David Henning
text: I've been there twice and both times I was treated better than I deserve.  They took special care with my vintage bass and did the repairs at a reasonable price.  Great selection.  Friendly, helpful staff.  So good to have a dependable music store in Trussville.  ** Don't miss the store.  You have to pull into the Dollar General parking lot to get to the store.  They are across from DG.

name: Hollie Perry
text: I loved this place because the owner took time and effort to help me understand the differences between styles and sounds of the guitars and other musical instruments he currently had in store that my son is interested in. Most definitely will be returning customers.

name: Jerry Parmer
text: Unlike the big high volume stores that are only there to push products the sales staff are always willing to take the time to offer assistance.

name: Scott Henderson
text: Awesome staff. Great vibe

name: Darryl Gulley
text: Great people great price

name: Jeron Albrets
text: Good people, very nice environment, and great prices!

name: Marcy Sharit
text: Nice folks!

name: Cobain P
text: WOW!!!! Amazing store, with great stock, at great prices, with even better customer service!!! Felt so welcomed as soon as I got two steps in the store, by one of THE best salesman that I’ve ever met in my life!!! I will always do any & all my music shopping here!!!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review. Great people are hard to find but we are really blessed in finding people who still care about the customers.

name: Steve W
text:
I had an absolutely great experience in this huge, well-stocked store. Salesperson, Erskine, was awesome. No pressure, very helpful, patiently letting me try out one guitar after another to make sure I was happy with the amp.

I could have bought this on-line and had it shipped for free and saved $85 in taxes - but I felt the experience was worth paying a little more, and worth supporting a local (non-chain) business.

There are some negative reviews here. I’m sure with doing a lot of sales and service, someone won’t be happy. But I did not experience anything but great gear, and a helpful no-pressure salesman.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review. Great people are hard to find but we are really blessed in finding people who still care about the customers. Erskin has been selling in Birmingham for over 25 years we are lucky to have such a caring salesperson.

name: Fretjoe
text: Great people to do business, they were the only place in Alabama that could fix our churches Roland keyboard.  Great service, thank you!!

name: Dave Cleveland
text:
I was driving back to Franklin Tn today from Ga and stopped in the shop.
Everyone was extremely kind and the store looked great!
I was super impressed with John in the electric room. Not only did they stock the “must have pedals” they also had pedals that help players find and define their individual sound.
John had a thorough knowledge of all the gear in the room. I highly recommend the shop!!
Dave

resp.text: Thanks, Dave for the kind words. 2020 has been really strange for all of us. It's been really hard to keep everything in stock. Hope to see you soon and send someone to see us.

name: Ben
text: We love Bailey Brothers. They are personable, they have good prices, and they fix you up with everything you need. If you're in the market for a guitar, be sure to ask for Joseph.

resp.text: Thanks Ben, Joe is a real asset here at bailey brothers .

name: Joel Pearson
text:
I just want to say I am completely blown away by the level of customer service that I received on my last purchase. I didn't really think about writing a review after the first guitar that I bought there, but now that I have another experience from a major purchase I just had to say something to the public.
Over the years I have also purchased smaller items because it was convenient to me to stop by and get things like cables, picks, capos, and other little odds and ends for guitar and bass that I use. This time I bought a relatively inexpensive guitar there; an epiphone Les Paul special, in the TV yellow color. I even traded another guitar towards it.  I thought they were very fair on their trade value and reasonable in their explanation of how that works. The reason I feel like I had an exceptional experience was they treated me very good even though the $ value I was spending wasn't that high. Looking back I was thinking that I don't think I could have gotten a better experience even if I had been purchasing a $2,500 Gibson! I felt like a valued customer and they answered all of my quirky questions and help me find a hardshell case that was in my budget and I am very happy with the final price and how the deal worked out.
Please go patronize this business. They deserve it because they work hard for their customers and they let you know if something is within their ability to produce or not. They have my business from now on because of how I was treated on this deal and looking back on other deals too. I think their prices are fair they are better than retail. Overall, I am super excited about my purchase and very happy with my experience with Bailey Brothers music company.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review .  We aim to please , Blown away is our goal for sure .

name: Charlie Thompson
text: The best stock in Alabama and possibly the Southeast. Great helpful people who  offer installation, rentals and Backline. Ben is GM and Joseph is an incredible luthier. Worth your time to stop and look.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words . That means a lot coming from you .

name: JOSH DRUMMOND
text: Good selection of musical equipment. Be prepared because they strictly enforce the muzzle mandate inside. They make you wear masks.

resp.text: Thanks for the compliment on our selection.   We're not enjoying the mask mandate, but we are trying to follow the rules to keep everyone safe.  We look forward to seeing everyone's faces again soon.

name: Robin Joshi
text: Ask them if you can try out one of their 5k+ custom shop stratocasters, and they'll hand it to you just like that. No sweat.

resp.text: We love the good stuff and we hope everyone else does to . The right gear does matter. Thanks for the 5-star review.

name: Sean Callahan
text: These guys are the best! Ben is very knowledgable, honest, responsive and personable. He is very easy to talk to and work out any potential sales with. He has helped me out a lot and I have bought a few products with them including a Gibson and some Boss pedals. The customer service experience has been outstanding and the site is also very convenient given it has a live chat agent. Can't recommend enough! Check them out! Thanks Bailey Brothers Music Company!

name: Hellonwheels999 (Hellonwheels999)
text: Went to look for Double bass drum pedals. The initial phone call, drums guy was polite, explained and answered questions in a manner that didnt feel rushed or annoyed. Off to the store. The Drums guy showed me their selection and prices, explained a little about each set then backed off and let me make a decision without the classic Guitar Center upsell attempt "just buy this one because [ insert cheesy sell line here] ". Dude that spoke volumes about this store, they werent watching people like police, *cough* Guitar center *cough* they have a better product than other stores in particular the Mapex $119 double bass set has better reviews and looks more sturdy than the Mapex double bass pedals sold at GC for $129 on sale at time of this review for $119. Then on to sticks, again took time to understand what i wanted and what i was desiring to recommend the right product and not the top dollar one! Now off to the front counter, set my stuff down at the reg and told them i was going to wait because i also needed guitar strings. I naturally went for Ernie Ball, but the cashier guy began to tell me about different brand he uses, explained why and also hit all the issues with strings i was having on the head. Its nice to go to music store where people are actually musicians and know what theyre talking about and selling. I definitely will be back. AND i definitely will tell anyone who asks about a music store about them!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words!

name: Brent Thompson
text: Usually get good service, but I took my guitar nut to be repaired after my guitar took a spill. I let them know the guitar had fallen and hoped they would fix. The nut was replaced poorly but the guitar had a buzz. Took it back 2 more times. The last visit, the person in charge of the repair (2 weeks later)said I had heavy fingers and raised the stings to a height that made the guitar unplayable. I took to another repair shop and they repaired the nut replaced by Bailey Brothers found a couple of uneven frets repaired  the frets adjusted the neck and had to re-setup the guitar from the disaster repair at Bailey Brothers. If in need of repairs I will never return to this store.

name: joe law
text: Just bought my dream guitar here.  The guitar guy, Erskine Milton, Was very accommodating and patient with me.  I played several very nice guitars and he was all too willing to help me in any way.  I love my new 58 VOS Les Paul Custom.  Thank you Erskine for taking the time to help me pick my perfect guitar!!!!

resp.text: Thank You for the 5 Star review. Hope the guitar is still sounding great. Please follow us on Facebook and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us. Thank you for the business and Erskin is the bomb for sure. drop by and tell them I said for you to get a new bbmc shirt.

name: Danny Kircus
text: I have bought a LOT of equipment from these guys over the years.  They have the best brands at good prices.  Always super nice and knowledgeable about their products.  My go to music store in central Alabama.  They are like family.  We are lucky to have them here.

resp.text: Danny , Thank You for the 5 Star review. The people on the floor really do a great job of helping. Please follow us on Facebook for our live shows and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us.

name: Brandon Martin
text: Super friendly and helpful staff.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review. Great people are hard to find but we are really blessed in finding people who still care about the customers. .

name: Joseph Beavers
text: Best guitar store in Alabama! Took my Les Paul in for a pickup swap and they fixed three other problems with it and didn't even charge me for it! I was so impressed that I bought an amp the same day! Thanks guys!

resp.text: Joseph, Thank You for the 5 Star review. Hope the Les Paul is still sounding great. Please follow us on Facebook for our live shows and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us.  Thank you for the business

name: Teddy Jamieson
text: Do NOT trust for online sales.  I found a  guitar in their website, comminucated back and forth for a few days. Decided to pull the trigger and put a deposit down while I waited on a new card. Received a call 5 days after I paid that the item hadn't been sold but was "promised" to an employee and even though I paid they would not offer the transaction. S H A D Y business.

resp.text:
I AM SORRY BUT this guy has worked there for 10 years and never ask to buy a guitar. He had asked the salesperson to hold it for him while he got his dollars together. it just did not get taken out of the computer has available, our mistake. Sorry, but he had made a promise and it was important to keep it. Your salesman could have just told you there was a crack in the headstock and you would have been fine but he was honest with you thinking you would understand. I understand you feel you were mistreated. if there is anything I can do to make you happy I will. please hit the salesperson up and tell him Clyde told you to ask for a deal on anything you see on the website or special order you may like a killer deal on. the salesperson you were dealing with is one of our VIP services masters.  Just tell him to ask CLYDE for the deal.
Again I am sorry.

name: Howler Wolf
text:
Recently brought a used instrument to these guys to be cleaned and conditioned. They charged $230 and I'm not really sure what they did beyond $40 worth of repairing. I even priced the individual parts myself and they cost a total of $23. The instrument was very dirty and they didn't even do a good or complete job of wiping it down. We didn't get any paperwork explicitly stating what they were going to do so we can't really argue the point. The inside of the instrument wasn't even touched during cleaning because there is obvious dust and grime that was there when we gave it to these guys.

We also bought a mouthpiece for the instrument, I previously priced it at $10 online and it was $35 at this place. An outrageous markup.

All of this was after agreeing to a monthly payment for an instrument only to be informed the day before it was needed that they didn't have any in stock so we had to scramble to find a different option. Because of this, they also didn't send us a cleaning kit for the instrument that had been fully paid for.

I will be looking for another place for any other instrument needs.

name: Richard Hlavaty
text:
Bought a Takamine in the Montgomery BBM store 1995, and recently had some fret work. It plays like new.
Thanks Clay, for the great customer service, and putting me on a guitar to suit my playing needs 👍

resp.text: Thanks big man  Thank You for the 5 Star review. Hope the Takamine  is still killer. Please follow us on Facebook and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see me. Thank you for the business over the years and i think you should start a cooking webcast on face book. Your stuff looks good enough to eat.  If you are in b-ham come see me.

name: James Wood
text: Amazing selection. Employees were really helpful in finding the right guitar for me.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and we are so happy you found the right guitar. Let us know what next and how you are doing on your musical journey soon. Send someone to see us. Thanks again

name: BIll McClain
text: Easily the best music store in Bham.  Great selection, knowledgeable and friendly staff. Always have what I need!

name: Walter Rosen
text: Love the products and love the service

resp.text: We try to hire the best we can find . Thanks for the Great review.

name: Tanner Jones
text: Very friendly customer service, and they worked extremely quickly to get my order shipped. Definitely recommend using them!

resp.text: Tanner, Thank You for the 5 Star review. The people here do a great job of helping. Please follow us on Facebook for our live shows and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us at baileybrothers.com.

name: Mc Spankies
text: Bought two instruments here an epiphone Sheraton and a epiphone eb 3 and a fender rumble 40. They were very patient and worked out a great deal and didnt rush or push me. 10/10 definitely shop here again

resp.text: Mr Spankey , Thank You for the 5 Star review. Hope the gear is still sounding great. Please follow us on Facebook and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us. Thank you for the business

name: Craig Winn
text: Very helpful staff. My two kids want to start playing guitar and violin. The salesperson was patient in helping the kids and was not condescending at all. He was patient and even helped my left handed child decide if she needed a right or left handed guitar. Turns out that even though she is very left handed the right handed guitar felt better. Also their stick was very impressive.  Lots and lots of stuff everywhere.

name: Jacob Hazelwood
text: It was my first time in the store and I had an excellent experience. David was very helpful and friendly as well as the other staff present. The online site lacks a lot of the guitars they have in stock because they get new guitars a lot so I would advise actually going into the store to see their wide selection.

name: Allen Mark Russell
text: Great selection of quality guitars and a staff that is knowledgeable about what they sell.

name: K Benoit
text:
This place is as good as, if not better than, Guitar Center. But this one man that works there is not the friendliest and makes me and my music buddy never wanna come again... I was gonna buy at least $20-$60 of stuff, and my buddy was gonna get his guitar worked on, but we decided against it after our experience today.
My friend and I were playing our guitars together at moderate volumes. No louder than the other customers that passed through. Our volume knobs probably were set around 1. This rude clerk guy came up to us and told us "turn it down, there are customers in here". When there was maybe 1 other guy in the guitar room at most. What are we, trash? Are we not customers?
Though to be fair, there was a little kid who sat behind us who was louder than both of us combined, and he was tremolo picking the most random nonsensical annoying noise (future shredder?), but he should've told the kid to turn down—not us. We both turned our amps off because he was rude the last time we were in the store and we were pretty annoyed at this point. But the kid turned his amp down and continued the random picking and the dude immediately came back and said "hey, okay, turn it off, that's enough for today" and took the guitar from the kid. The rudest music store clerk we've ever encountered. There's another guy who is super nice that works there who let us turn the volume up—at least 2 or 3 times what we did today—and test every amp in the store. We bought a $2,000 setup from the nice guy in the past, but this rude guy would probably kick us out of the store before we could make a purchase. I didn't catch his name, but he's average height, blondish, his hair is thinning, and he had a short beard. A nicer worker told us he's been there 3 years, though I'm not sure how he's lasted that long. He'll probably follow you around like you're a thief and ask if he can help you 8 times like he did to us the last time we came in the store simply to buy a cable.

name: CLAY BAILEY
text: This place has always been good to me.

name: Ryan Burke
text: It was my first time in here recently and I had a pleasant experience. David made sure I felt welcomed and was very helpful in answering any questions I had. Overall they have a great selection and friendly staff.

name: Johnathan Weldon
text: Great people, great deals, great customer service! Whether you’re buying online or in person, you’ll be glad you shopped with these guys. I have done business with them for a long time, just bought a new Fender Strat and couldn’t be more pleased with the product and the service, they always go above and beyond. I  will definitely return, like I always have.

name: Tyler Brown
text: These guys are always super helpful.

resp.text: Tyler, Thank You for the 5 Star review. The people on the floor really do a great job of helping. Please follow us on Facebook for our live shows and check out our baileybrothers.com site for new products and special sales. Please send someone to see us.

name: Ben A
text: Kevin was very helpful in fixing my guitar I purchased over a year ago. Was having some issues with my saddle and strings breaking every show for the last few weeks. Fixed it in just a few minutes and restrung my instrument for a Very affordable price. Love the guys at bailey brothers.

name: Allie
text: Super nice store full of super helpful people. I visited this location three times in one day, as I was undecided and trying to deal with the idiots at Guitar Center, and each time, a really nice gentleman, Erskine, helped me. He went back, spent the time finding the guitar I was after, took it out of the box even when I wasn't for sure on buying it, and tuned it for me. Ultimately, his attitude, kindness, and knowledge was what sold me on my guitar. After the run around at Guitar Center, he was just what I needed. Thank you so much!

name: Chris Peters
text: I love shopping at Bailey Bros on 280. The sales staff is great, especially one of the guys named Sammy. He is always very helpful and knowledgeable. He always helps me find the perfect gear for me. Good prices and excellent service. Over all, I always have a great experience shopping there.

name: Talia Ledbetter
text: Kindest and most knowledgeable employees I’ve experienced. They deserve anyone’s business who is interested in learning more about music or getting their gear improved. Todd particularly is super nice and helpful.

name: Dustin Reaves
text: Always very friendly and service oriented.

resp.text: Dustin thank you for the 5 star rating . We have a great crew and we really love sharing the joy of music. Follow us on Facebook or look for deals at baileybrothers.com .  Thank you again.

name: Kristen Russo
text: My daughter has taken drum lessons at Bailey Brothers for over nine months now. We could not be happier. The customer service we receive from the front desk is wonderful, and her teacher, Leif, is so nice and is an excellent drummer and instructor. The price for their lessons is very competitive, and they are conveniently located. I couldn't ask for more!

name: Mark Pyle
text:
This full service family owned music store is the best I have ever shopped at. The staff is very knowledgeable about the products and that is rare in this market of corporate box stores. Do yourself a favor and go see them before you make a purchase....It's well worth the drive.

Dr. Mark Pyle
Florence, AL

name: Owen Stayner/ThisWorkplace360
text:
Purchased a Les Paul Bass here years ago-- still enjoying it.
Thank you BB Music.

name: James Summers
text: It was really nice and organized. The people who helped me where real nice and even tho my age they still talked to me in a professional tone.

name: Sky Morriss
text: I can't speak for the rest of the people who work there but I spoke to a man about selling a saxophone and he was the rudest clerk I have ever encountered. If you need a music store, try Art's! They're right across the street and are actually nice to their customers.

name: Silven Cox
text: Hands down my favorite store in the Birmingham area. Great staff, and good selection.

name: Amber Nicole
text: good staff well organize not bad products

resp.text: Thank You for the 3 Star review?  Please follow us on Facebook and check out our baileybrothers.com site . Please send someone to see us. Thank you for the business and  drop by and tell them I said for you to get a new bbmc shirt. I HOPE WE CAN IMPROVE ON THE 3 STAR REVIEW.

name: Andrew Krist
text:
Had a pretty poor experience the one time I went to Bailey Brothers Music.

I went there to trade in a partscaster tele for a guitar pedal. I started looking at some envelope filters and some guy came out of the back trying to tell me that envelope filters are only for bass players. Told him about the dead and others, and he changed his stance from “auto wahs are for bass only” to “well the mu-trons are for bass and the Q-trons are for guitar”.

First of all, Jerry Garcia, Trey Anastasio, Keller Williams and countless others use mu trons in their guitar rigs. Second, the Q-tron is just a pedal made by EHX that’s also an envelope filter. Hell people use MXR’s bass envelope filters on their guitar rigs. So the overall musical knowledge when it came to pedals wasn’t very high in my experience.

Also, when I went to trade my partscaster in, the guy offered me $125 for it. I later learned that this was a pretty bad lowball, as I got offered $200 at a much smaller guitar store. At first I said $125 was fine, if he would bring the price on a boss envelope filter down from $130 to $125. The guy said no, on a five dollar difference. I ended up taking my guitar somewhere else and (thank god) getting $200 for it.

I’m giving this place two stars because they did have a large selection. Not a super interesting selection, but large. Also the staff was friendly, although not as knowledgeable as I’d hoped. Sadly I will not be going back to Bailey Brothers.

resp.text: SORRY FOR THE BAD EXPERANCE , sounds terrible. I wish i knew what the guys name was who waited on you . I would bet he is no longer here.  we have the best guys here , we do hire new guys that sometime dont work out because they cant learn the gear, sorry again and not sure we deserve 2 stars but would love the chance to improve on that .

name: Bebe Stringfield
text: We always go here for our musical needs. I love the place. They are always friendly and helpful. I would recommend any musician to this place.

name: Coleman Haines
text: This place is awesome, need customer service? DONE! Need a repair? DONE! Need to place an order? DONE! The only thing I did not like was the lack of extended range instruments. You will not be finding fanned fret, 28 fret, tap guitar, etc. You want those go to WARR guitars or order them off of a musicians website.

name: John Watson
text: Great place for electric & acoustic guitars with huge selection of amps also.Kevin is a wizard with guitars.Shop here before buying

name: Linda Pierre
text: I needed 2 wireless mics for our church's old PA system. They are so helpful! They want to make sure that what you purchase from them will work! Nothing like good customer service!

name: Wrath
text:
Dishonest, and disrespectful. While I'm aware they have an "all sales final" on used gear policy, it is their responsibility to properly inspect the gear they take in and not sell something that is damaged internally (in my case, a guitar amp). Idiot salesman also had a smug grin on his face the whole time my brother and I were having to deal with it (all 5-6 hours) and was making snooty comments back and forth. In a nut shell they sold me a dead amp and then laughed in my face about it. If this is how your business treats customers, don't expect to be a business for long. I attempted a purchase with Bailey Brothers about 8 years ago. Was not a pleasant experience. This one wasn't either. Rest assured, that's it. I will not be back.

Update: Hey the owner called me just to prove they really do not care about customers. Tried to minimize what happened, and basically acted exactly like Keith did. Also a robotic "I apologize but we're not going to do anything to fix it" does not count as rectifying anything. Gee wonder why the Southside store closed! Oh yeah and if you have a bad experience with them and they don't own up to it they'll do like any typical teenager does and tries to badmouth you on Facebook, then stalk your page. Very mature. Screenshots are great though aren't they?

PS: Oh and buddy, if I were mad and desperate to pay my rent, then why in the heck did I buy a $700 amp from you? Nice try.

name: jbs3301
text: Over the years I habe purchased thousands of dollarsof gear from Bailey Brothers. I have always found the owner and staff to be knowledgeable and courteous. I have found their prices to be competitive with national big box stores, but they offer personalized service as a family owned business that the chain stores can't. They will stand behind their product.

name: Uncle Zeb
text: I left my guitar with this store in February 2012 for a simple repair. In June it was still hanging waiting for them to repair. I had been told on multiple occasions that it would be ready in just a few days. I picked it up today June 24, 2012 and no repair has been done and I was still charged a bench fee. This place sucks. I will never go in there again. Good luck if you do.

name: Bill Young
text: Great staff, prices and awesome selection in stock! Been buying gear from them for over 20 years. Always happy!

name: Hal and Alison Ashmore
text: I have done business with these guys from day one in downtown Montgomery. I now live in Gadsden drive over an hour to their store. Always a good time and worth the drive to find what I need!

name: Todd Troulias
text: Great place for all my music needs. Friendly staff and reasonable prices.

name: Anand Iyer
text: I needed to buy instruments for my Middle School kids. They were very upfront with their prices and seemed to have the best deals.

name: Clay McCown
text: I frequently shop at this store and have always been treated well. The workers know my name and are consistently friendly and helpful with great product knowledge.

name: Mac McQueen
text: Awesome place. Feels like a real music store. Great customer service.

name: Fag Bag
text: A man asked for cheese

resp.text: Then cheese he got .

name: Sandra Lyle
text: Good service. Knowledgeable staff.  Wish there was one closer to us!

name: Mary Goodman
text: No stars really.  Not a very good merchant.  Let someone use my credit card number without the card!  Be careful!

name: Jeremiah Miller
text: Awesome store and great customer service.

name: Leon Pettway
text: I explained to them thoroughly what I needed and they sold me the opposite! It all about sells and f**k the customers needs! Stay away from the southside location!

name: SpecOpsElite
text: Bought a pop filter and its freaking amazing! Helpful and friendly Customer Service.

name: Casey Benefield (Think A Little)
text:
I would use profane language, but it would not adequately describe the crap this company pulled. Basically, I took my brother to trade a PRISTINE first-owner amp, and we could prove it, in for a Fender Hot Rod Deluxe, used, which is of equal value....and my brother coughed up $100.

I took off work to take him to initially buy the thing. I took off work to bring it in for repair when we discovered sticky crap on the power tubes, and I ended up working until 10PM thanks to these guys. They wanted me to take off work again, after having spent 5 hours in their store. I basically spoke up and said, he might be the customer, but I'm the wheelman, and I'm furious. I mentioned the fact of the wasted gas, wasted trips, and the at least 6 hours of driving they were expecting of me.

They checked OUR amp out very thoroughly, and even treated my brother like a criminal, saying they are getting his DL in case he stole it. SERIOUSLY people....

I tried to talk some business sense with them, asking them to do something for the trouble, and it would not have taken much. They said no. Then I asked if they can just reverse everything since ALL of the stuff was still in the store.... The guy made up a story of a law, which actually doesn't exist, then claiming he has to charge extra to reverse it all. Guitar Center evidently doesn't know about this (fake) law.

Not ONLY that, but the smug, d-bag attitude that the guy gave me when pushing my brother, his CUSTOMER aside to say "you don't think we're trying to rip you off do you?" He did this to put me on the spot, and tried to make me look like the bad guy.

In the end, my brother spent another $170 to get a new model. In the end, he got what he wanted, but we are both appalled by how the guy behaved to our faces. Beware, their used gear has NO warranty, but they represented at sale that they would ensure the gear works if something went wrong like the day we get it... Well... it did.

You don't take someone's $700 amp + $100 and then give them junk, and not try to do something proper after dragging someone thru hell. That's the bottom line. I tried more than the guy at this store. You won't catch us in that place again.

Considering the tens of thousands that my brother spent with other companies, Bailey Brothers missed an opportunity... Not good business. Dishonest, rude, and outright condescending.  Smiled at us when we expressed our frustration with the runaround....

name: Bunky Anderson
text: always has anything i need for backline company--lewis is best drum guy in town !!!!

name: Mitchel Bunting
text: This is the only location in alabama that sells Fretlight  guitars. They range from beginner to pro.and the whole neck lights up with led's  to teach you how to play.

name: JR Robison
text: always tough to leave this place without bringing something home. Great selection, awesome staff.

name: Stella Spivey
text: The people at Bailey Brothers are so nice and helping people

name: Bailey Jackson
text: Great experience at Bailey Brothers Music. Highly recommended.

name: Fletcher Louallen,Sr.
text: great

name: Ken
text: Always the best deals and best service!!!

name: Andrew Moncrief
text: Great place to purchase.

name: clay bailey
text: ALWAYS A GOOD TIME

name: Charlie Morrison
text: Don't answer the phone
